column4: Did user management change in the upgrade from 7.10 to 8.04?  The "Users and Groups" tool doesn't list any users.
it changed in that it uses policykit now. Can you see/use the Unlock button?
that's strange -- I think you may be looking at a bug
I have some users listed in /etc/passwd.  One is my normal account and one is for svn, which is not formatted the same as my user account.  Maybe it's choking on that...
your /etc/passwd seems to be messed up
do you want to put it up on a pastebin?
I'm thinking that user management tool nuked it TBH.  I was using sudo just before running that thing.
hope you have a backup of /etc/passwd
No I don't; I haven't ever edited after installing Ubuntu
you may be able to reconstruct it from a live system's copy
you don't believe in backups, then?
Yes--I clicked the unlock button to access the users and groups.  After that it listed no users, but it was unlocked (unlock button was checked and greyed out)
you don't use a root password on Ubuntu
